programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod argue over the value of a bizarre horse's head. Barry bids for a locker full of antique furniture, and Dave makes his strangest discovery ever.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick gets the chance to purchase a page from the Gutenberg Bible, and Corey checks out a rare six-sheet movie poster from the classic Ziegfeld Follies.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey check out an original Superman costume, but it remains to be seen whether the asking price is too much for their budget.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds gear up to shoot a new commercial for the store, but the signs are that not everyone will be happy with the final result. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Seth harbour some serious doubts after Karen brings in a Feng Shui expert in the hope of boosting sales and gaining a positive energy.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron and Tyler work on restoring a vending machine, while the rest of the team take on two children's handcar trains.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Brettly oversees the difficult restoration of a 1965 truck, while Ron and Tyler work on a peep show machine from the 1940s.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.desc: The murder of Rachel Moran, who went missing in Hull on New Year's Day 2004, and how a mass police search eventually led to finding her killer.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Investigators piece together the sinister puzzle of a primary school teacher went missing after her first day at a new job in 1993.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A bidding war erupts between the buyers as they attend the latest round of auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor tries to end his losing streak in Waxahachie, but faces some tough competition.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Les head off to a huge estate sale. Seth takes a custom Corvette go-kart for a spin and Karen eyes up a piece of 1970s movie memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets invited to give a lecture at a local business school. Meanwhile, Ashley and Bobby J go to war over a collection of Nerf guns.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A prop from the movie Cleopatra and a 1922 silver peace dollar make for an interesting day at the Gold and Silver pawn shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed picture of the original Star Trek cast and an Eli Whitney Civil War revolver both pique the Pawn Stars' interest.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts open previously off-limits secret files in a bid to answer some of the most mysterious questions surrounding UFOs and extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A think-tank of top global experts examines whether America's founding fathers hid extra-terrestrial secrets in their documents, buildings and symbols.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his team restore a large cannonball safe dating from the 1920s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick fixes up a 1930s fishing boat, and takes on the tricky task of repairing a 19th-century coffee grinder.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee meets Marvel Comics creator Stan Lee to find out if a rare signed comic is the real thing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a Gilded Age train, before a classic Nintendo race car game from the 1960s rolls its way into the shop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers look for 1970s memorabilia in California, where Barry finds a relic from his past and Darrell discovers a lucrative medical device.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Santa Ana, California, where an inexpensive-looking locker could lead to a huge payout for one team.

programme.desc: The buyers attend auctions in a small town where one of the teams acquires a strange wooden box that turns out to have unexpected value.

programme.desc: The guys examine a letter from Founding Father James Monroe and a promotional Playboy chair. Chum tries to reinvent himself in the image of Hugh Hefner.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey checks out a 1972 telegram that prevents Muhammad Ali from fighting in Alaska, and a first edition copy of Oscar Wilde's The Happy Prince arrives in store.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.sub-title: Aliens and the Creation of Man
programme.desc: Can unexplained advances in human evolution be attributed to alien architects? Giorgio Tsoukalos joines forces with alien theorists to look at the evidence.

programme.desc: Les questions Ashley's management skills when two employees get into a fight on the shop floor. Meanwhile, Seth stumbles upon a potentially huge deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hatches a secret plan to put his employees to the test, but how will Seth, Ashley and Karen react when they find out.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell fights off competition as he tries to secure a locker worth $27,000, and Dave bids for a unit with a stockpile of antiques.

programme.title: Storage Wars

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey comes face to face with a Ronald Reagan foam head, but it remains to be seen whether he will make an offer on the piece.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Skipper Dwayne and the crew head to a consistent urchin dive spot, where young dingy boy George endures a baptism of fire as everyone fights to bring in the most urchins.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Australia's brumbies are widely regarded as pests and shot by choppers, so Matt Wright plans to relieve the problem by rounding up the horses and giving them a better life.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Sean Lock and Bill Bailey for more interesting answers on subjects including beetles and baguettes in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Zoe Lyons, Milton Jones, Nish Kumar and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. Recorded in September 2016.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Phil Kay and Rich Hall for more interesting answers on subjects including birds, bills and brothers in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Sean Lock and Bill Bailey for more interesting answers on subjects including beetles and baguettes in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Flack
programme.desc: Drama about an American PR executive living in London, who must figure out how to make the best of bad situations and somehow manage to escape unscathed herself. Robyn dashes to a hotel to clean up a horrendous mess created by a prominent footballer on a sex-and-drug-fuelled bender. Fearsome boss Caroline (Sophie Okonedo) then sends her to kill off the latest of many one-night-stand stories circulating about another client, the 'housewives' favourite' celebrity chef Anthony Henderson (guest star Max Beesley).

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor, Steve Pemberton, Fern Britton and Josh Widdicombe test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Halloween weekend sees the squad called to investigate a hair-raising skirmish at a nightclub. Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a museum in Louisiana dedicated to Bonnie and Clyde, and examine a roadie's collection of valuable rock memorabilia.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: T-Money dreams of money when he bids on a huge, chained-up container.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: T-Money bids on some mystery casks, before discovering a German gun.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys find a replica spaceship during a picking trip in Louisiana, and Mike employs some new negotiating tactics to get a suitable price.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are presented with a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity in Texas and also uncover a stash that includes a meteorite.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The team tries to save the police's ailing horse wagons. An officer escapes with his life after a pursuit car is rammed by a stolen 4x4, while the mounted unit keeps the peace at one of the biggest football clashes of the year.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May shop for second-hand convertibles, uncovering the pitfalls to avoid when buying a used car, and Jeremy also gets the opportunity to test-drive the Pagani Zonda R. Actor Simon Pegg takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Nottinghamshire Bodycam Cops Annie and Dave investigate a disturbance in a back garden, but when an intruder turns violent, Annie is left with a life-changing injury.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve and the Welderup gang have got their work cut out for them when a couple commissions a build to celebrate their impending wedding anniversary.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond tackle the traffic chaos snowy weather causes in Britain, and hit upon a solution involving a combine harvester, some rudimentary engineering skills and a trip to Norway. Jeremy also tests the Audi RS5 and the BMW M3, and American actress and model Amber Heard is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters square up to their Australian counterparts in an automotive version of the Ashes, with challenges including rallying, drifting and a double-decker car race. Jeremy Clarkson also test-drives the Ferrari 599 GTO, and Boris Becker gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: An extended edition of the quiz show, in which question-master Stephen Fry probes the subject of Messing with Your Mind, with Sarah Millican, Tommy Tiernan and Josh Widdicombe competing alongside resident panellist Alan Davies. As usual, points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe, actor and writer Steve Pemberton and presenter Fern Britton continue the daily test of their skills. Hosted by Richard Osman.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by birdwatcher Bill Oddie and comedians Frank Skinner, Jon Richardson and Sarah Millican on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Actor Mackenzie Crook, wildlife presenter Chris Packham, writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell and comedian Rhod Gilbert join David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with odd personal statements that may or may not be true.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Rob Brydon, Sarah Millican and Jason Byrne
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the stand-up show from the Hammersmith Apollo, and welcomes fellow comics Sarah Millican and Jason Byrne to the stage.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Nish Kumar pretends he is Robin Hood and Aisling Bea bleeds on bread, while Mark Watson feels the wrath of yoghurt.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Phill Jupitus and Rich Hall for more interesting answers on subjects including bombs, bats and bagpipes in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Jeremy Hardy, Barry Cryer and Jeremy Clarkson for more interesting answers on subjects including Birmingham, Bhutan and baldness in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy sketches, including Done to Death. With music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction and maintenance of the International Space Station, revealing the influence of an unconventional aircraft designer and a 19th-century rebreather.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The US Navy's fastest combat ships, which are capable of a turn of speed only possible due to a revolutionary water propulsion system and the chance discovery of a brand new alloy.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history, beginning with a man from Bermondsey who vanished without trace in 1849.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The US Navy's fastest combat ships, which are capable of a turn of speed only possible due to a revolutionary water propulsion system and the chance discovery of a brand new alloy.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The fate of a Canadian warship that went to the aid of an American freighter rocked by an explosion in 1944. More than 60 years on, divers uncover new evidence of the sinking.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history. At the time of Jack the Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner, George Chapman. Presenter Nicholas Day reveals how he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the East Lancashire Railway, the annual Race the Train event gets under way - with athletes of all abilities taking on the 11-mile course from Bury to Rawtenstall.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Meeting the Welsh Highland Railway's oldest volunteer fireman, 80-year-old Cedric Lodge, who has worked on the railways for 60 years. In Devon, there is a look at the Autotrain.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An eerie, empty country village which hides a sad secret, a mysterious tower battered by the elements and a disused railway deep beneath the streets of a city.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Claustrophobic prison cells that contain a story worthy of international acclaim, and a vast mountainside complex that held the power to change the world.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy sketches, including Wedding Service and Done to Death. With guests Diane Keen and Sue Lloyd, and music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy sketches, including Done to Death. With music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A dying man's last desperate answerphone message confuses the police and hampers their investigation into his murder. Adding to the air of mystery surrounding the case, it also sets his son off on a nightmare journey. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring Mark McManus, James Macpherson, Blythe Duff, Iain Anders, Harriet Buchan and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Wealthy widow Alice Costigan invites Robert to stay at her country house for a spot of pheasant shooting, filling him with high hopes of romance. However, he's not the only one vying for her affections, and when her nephew falls ill she snubs him by turning to his rival for help. Victorian medical drama, starring Jemma Redgrave, David Calder, Maureen Beattie and Andrew Connolly.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Having discovered Irene Radford is back, Gina is determined to put her old enemy behind bars once and for all - and the two are soon face to face again when an intruder at the Radford house turns out to be Irene herself, who claims she has returned because she is critically ill with cancer. However, the police have got wind that she is plotting one final raid before retiring from a life of crime for good, so Phil is tasked to monitor a prison meeting between Irene and her son David, where the top brass are hoping he'll glean valuable information about the job. Unfortunately, the philandering DS is easily distracted by an old flame working at the prison and misses half the conversation - so when the raid gets under way, it soon becomes clear they've been duped, and a senior officer ends up staring down the barrel of Irene's gun. Back at the station, Honey is upset to learn that Amber has taken the 'shy and sensitive' Steve Hunter's virginity, while Sam seems to be warming to Phil. Is ro.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Marsham learns his wife has breast cancer and tries to make amends for neglecting her, shelving a planned move to Scotland and begging Robert and Eleanor to perform a life-saving operation. Medical drama, starring Jemma Redgrave and David Calder.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A remote British-ruled island in the South Pacific is invaded and the King's Own Fusiliers find themselves part of the task force sent to retake it. Unfortunately, Corporal Hobbs is soon captured and tortured by enemy troops, and Colonel Eastwood's daring plan of attack has explosive consequences.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Having discovered Irene Radford is back, Gina is determined to put her old enemy behind bars once and for all - and the two are soon face to face again when an intruder at the Radford house turns out to be Irene herself, who claims she has returned because she is critically ill with cancer. However, the police have got wind that she is plotting one final raid before retiring from a life of crime for good, so Phil is tasked to monitor a prison meeting between Irene and her son David, where the top brass are hoping he'll glean valuable information about the job. Unfortunately, the philandering DS is easily distracted by an old flame working at the prison and misses half the conversation - so when the raid gets under way, it soon becomes clear they've been duped, and a senior officer ends up staring down the barrel of Irene's gun. Back at the station, Honey is upset to learn that Amber has taken the 'shy and sensitive' Steve Hunter's virginity, while Sam seems to be warming to Phil. Is ro.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: On a busy night behind the bar, Mickie notices Jodie is becoming breathless and feverish, and tries to persuade her to seek medical help. Tricia and Mark find working together tense, but agree to be as professional as possible, while Diane suffers from pre-wedding jitters and turns to Ric for support. Her fears may be well-founded, as Owen's stag night ends with him kissing Chrissie.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A young rollerblade hockey player is coy about how he received his mysterious injuries, Liz's boyfriend leaves her for another woman, and Tina acts beyond the call of duty when she contacts Social Services about an injured boy.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Following the Radford family's botched attempt to spring David from prison, Irene drives off with Gina at gunpoint and forces the inspector to let her colleagues know she means business. If they don't give up the chase, she won't hesitate to pull the trigger. Soon, Gina finds herself alone with her enemy, and as they begin to talk, the two of them realise they understand one another better than they could possibly have imagined. However, when Irene orders the shooting of Jack Gaunt, it becomes clear Gina is still in very real danger. Meanwhile, Honey has it out with Steve, disappointed that he had sex with Amber, and accusing him of being as bad as his brother. Indeed, Phil is having his fair share of problems as Sam discovers that his New Year's invitation followed hard on the heels of his dalliance with the prison liaison officer. Roberta Taylor, Lynda Bellingham, Lisa Maxwell and Scott Maslen star.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pete takes time off to treat Christine to a day at the races, Mandy is the subject of gossip in the Square, and Dot interferes in Mark's life and gives Hattie shocking new.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: PatCabs needs another driver, Rachel and Kathy grab some bargains at the jumble sale, and Michelle gets a job offer. Sharon is impressed with Grant's hard work at the Vic.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are called to a DHSS office where a distressed claimant has covered himself in petrol and set himself alight. Starring Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Never Judge a Book by Its Cover
programme.desc: While searching a Cambridge antiques fair for religious books with Charlotte and Charlie Gimbert, Lovejoy discovers a rare Bible that seems to offer a solution to all his problems. Meanwhile, Tinker has a hard time persuading Beth's father that she should carry on working for such a rogue. Drama, guest starring Richard Briers and James Ellis, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim goes against his better judgement to help Philippa Vale - aka the Ice Maiden - discover who is trying to kill her. Drama, guest starring Liza Goddard, with John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie loses a valuable ring, while Jack, who found it and tried to pawn it, is filled with remorse. Meanwhile, Adrian shocks the family with his radical change in personality, insisting on being called Jimmy. Comedy, starring Jonathon Morris, Ronald Forfar, Victor McGuire and Jean Boht.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.sub-title: Desire in the Mickey Mouse Grotto
programme.desc: One of the yellowcoat's professionalism is questioned by a sharp-eyed passer-by who spots her entering a staff chalet late at night. With Simon Cadell, Ruth Madoc and Gillian Taylforth.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean accepts Lionel's proposal, but their happiness is not shared by everyone. Sandy walks out on her boyfriend while Stephen tries to organise a surprise party for Penny.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Merry Man with Billy, Then?
programme.desc: After recruitment for his Merry Men hits an all-time low, a letter from an enthusiast with excellent credentials gets Billy excited again, and he organises a committee to greet the newest member. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo Mills takes on the case of a worker killed on a building site, convinced that the managing director of the company should be held accountable for his neglect of health and safety legislation. However, the Lord Chancellor's department once again try to divert the course of justice to avoid embarrassment - and Deed's ex-wife is appointed counsel for the defence. Legal drama, starring Martin Shaw and Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a bloodstained pair of hot pants results in the team being asked to reinvestigate the 1971 disappearance of a mother and her six-month-old son. Lane, who worked on the original case, quickly identifies the victim's husband as the chief suspect, but when Halford and Standing learn two other women went missing in the area on the same day, they suspect they are looking for a serial killer. Amanda Redman stars.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A war begins between rival taxi firms, confronting the team with a series of coincidences to investigate, and Taggart's family problems are compounded when his daughter is implicated in a murder investigation. Glasgow-set detective drama, with Mark McManus, James MacPherson and Blythe Duff. Directed by series regular Alan Macmillan, who also worked on The Bill and Ballykissangel. The supporting cast includes Iain Anders, Robert Robertson, Stewart Preston, Harriet Buchan, Leigh Biagi, Andy McEwan and Peter O'Brien.

programme.title: Press Preview

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the royals' rollercoaster relationship with the press, beginning with the Queen's 1953-1954 Commonwealth tour, when cameramen worked hand-in-hand with the palace. A few years later, newspaper owner Lord Altrincham was attacked for daring to publish criticisms of the Queen, but by the mid-1970s Princess Margaret's hedonistic lifestyle was the subject of increasing press attention. But that was only the beginning. In the 1990s, the press has a field day over the breakdown of Charles and Diana's marriage, feeding on royal scandals.

programme.title: Rebound
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hosts the quickfire quiz that tests the general knowledge of six contestants, who go head to head in a bid to walk away with a big cash prize. The players must give as many correct answers as they can in the time it takes the 'Rebound Bar' to move across the studio, with the money on offer rising accordingly.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five workmates answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants who have never met before pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: A search gets underway, Wendy is left surprised by Victoria, and Jamie and Andrea do their best for Millie.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: A train breaks down in a tunnel near the Metro's busiest station, drawing attention to the fact that many of the vehicles in the Metro fleet are past their best. Track inspection supervisor Wayne has his work cut out repairing decaying sleepers which, if not quickly replaced, could cause a train derailment, and customer service manager Alan finds his quiet night in rudely interrupted when he is called into work to deal with an outbreak of anti-social behaviour.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Museum of the Family is packed with visitors to see a collection of miniature dolls houses donated by a real estate mogul - only for the businessman to be shot dead in front of the crowd. Barnaby's investigation uncovers evidence of unsafe living conditions for the victim's tenants that would have given plenty of people a reason to kill - as well as a mysterious death that a man was imprisoned for, despite protesting his innocence. Guest starring Joanna Page, Katy Brand and Eleanor Bron.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: The funerals approach, and without the answers he needs and still more questions being thrown up from White House Farm, Stan's efforts remain fruitless. When all looks lost for Stan and Mick solving the case, a vital witness comes forward. Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into the tragic events. Starring Alfie Allen, Mark Addy and Andrew Frame.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How towering scaffolds are built from giant poles of bamboo, and how people mine for the mineral that makes fireworks burn red.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a Maserati 3200 GT for under 10,000, but he suspects it is going to cost a lot of money to complete a successful makeover as problems include wayward handling, a hair-trigger throttle and a faulty air-conditioning system.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A 1937 Packard Convertible catches Wayne Carini's eye as he looks around an auction of unusual vehicles.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini fears a contact may have something to hide when he refuses to send photographs of some high-end classics he has on offer.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: Space Shuttle Tribute Bike - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team visits the Johnson Space Centre as part of preparations for building a Nasa-themed bike as a memorial to two crews who died in space.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.sub-title: 1963 Corvette and 1931 Model A Hot Rod
programme.desc: Electrician Dale Bagwell and the team take on a 1963 Chevrolet Corvette and a 1931 Model A Ford hot rod.

programme.title: Heli-Loggers
programme.desc: As the Brittain River project comes to an end, Kurtis Brown takes on one of the biggest trees of his career and Cleaver tries to get home quickly to his pregnant wife.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacture of glass paperweights and road salt, plus how nutcrackers and car doors are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in making black pudding, inorganic pigments and steering wheels.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how to build a port ready to receive the world's biggest container ships, and how 28 million plastic bags are made every day.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While Frank Fritz is on the mend. Mike Wolfe and his brother Robbie crisscross Colorado and find a giant cow-shaped RV.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A major storm arrives days into the opilio crab fishing season, bringing high seas and causing the captain of the Time Bandit to order his men to abandon their posts - moments before a wave crashes across the deck.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Summer storms keep the miners off the water, which causes them to lose valuable time. Meanwhile, Zeke proves he was not claim-jumping, but ends up getting shut down any way.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: The Mackay Brothers hit the bush and try to dodge destruction. Steve takes on an old enemy at the worst time of year and Bumpa Farrell struggles for power on an epic hay convoy.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Humvee to work on, and he and Edd China create a four-wheel-drive camping vehicle capable of venturing to places no camper has been before.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: A client brings in a perfectly running Porsche and a new Cadillac CTS-V. Noah challenges his crew to take the performance of these cars to the next level.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While Frank Fritz is on the mend. Mike Wolfe and his brother Robbie crisscross Colorado and find a giant cow-shaped RV.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: A new V/Line VLocity train is driven to its limits to pass the final test. The ageing Savannahlander railcar faces one of Australia's roughest tracks after a stormy wet season.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A combination of broken fishing pots and a damaged engine causes the Northwestern to fall a week behind schedule, and the captain comes up with a plan to improve his fortunes.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Inexperience and equipment problems cause conflict among the miners, while big swells and bad conditions leave some of the gold divers seasick.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to the Malvern Hills, where he unearths one of his most unusual finds. Plus, he visits a famed stone mason's in Liverpool to examine rare artisan carvings.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: There are headaches on the horizon for Steve taking on the Tanami with a trailer load of trouble and it's a wild ride for Nigel Vagg hauling 900 feral goats through a heatwave.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a Maserati 3200 GT for under 10,000, but he suspects it is going to cost a lot of money to complete a successful makeover as problems include wayward handling, a hair-trigger throttle and a faulty air-conditioning system.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Robbie uncover a hidden stash of awesome motorcycle relics at a Colorado property littered with massive man-mobiles.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Ian's fleet of ageing tractors buckle under the strain of the first harvest of the year. Ally faces spiralling costs as his new campsite venture slips months behind schedule.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Will Kirk restore a prized Davenport desk which was damaged by burglars, and Steve Fletcher tackles a tricky time-travelling conundrum.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A firefighting historian restores an antique helmet, a Victorian garden gnome is returned to its original condition and a treasured musical box is mended before the owner finds out.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how people handcraft Espadrilles shoes, how prefabricated houses are made, and how priceless documents are kept safe for hundreds of years.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into how the world's toughest and most expensive nut is harvested, how lake water is turned into tap water, and how thousands of pop fans are contained at gigs.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Investigators unravel a tale of adultery and greed as they try to solve the case of a family man murdered at a shopping centre 15 years earlier.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic examiners can expose a killer's deadly intentions when murder victims are lured to their deaths by acquaintances.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: In 2006, a man down on his luck transformed into one of Hollywood's most terrifying killers - Freddy Krueger. How and why did he mimic the character from A Nightmare on Elm Street?.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Timothy Moore, whose body was found in a shallow grave in April 2011, five months after he had been reported missing from his home in Washington's Willapa Bay. His son Devon later pleaded guilty to his murder.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents search for the killers of an elderly couple in a small Ohio community, and face a race against time to catch them before they strike again.

programme.title: Animal Cops
programme.desc: Inspectors battle to save a new-born foal, and agents discover the largest litter of puppies they have ever seen.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Archie the Labrador suffers life-threatening shakes, a canine gets a fishing hook stuck in its mouth, a snake takes a dip in an old woman's pool and a walleroo requires help.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: An interfering mother of the bride makes things difficult for Diane, while Keesha gets good news about the lump she found in her breast.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Injured army vet Shealynn is treated to a surprise when comedian Seth Meyers turns up, while model Ashley wants a slinky dress that also gets the approval of her father.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A customer brings her mother and sister with her to help choose a dress, and another bride does not know what she wants - but is very clear about what she does not like.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown meets Monty, the kid goat that cannot stop scratching, and Lisa treats a terrified German shepherd puppy. A feisty 42-year-old galah has an unappetising problem.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A dog is found with a tumour hanging from its neck, and the investigators face a legal battle to win custody of the animal before they can treat it.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Freak weather hits Texas and the team fights to save eight horses swimming in a flooded pasture, with one suffering potentially fatal wounds.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Upholsterer Ray Clarke tries to transform an unwanted pair of chairs, Josh and Oli have to show their mettle with some discarded brass and Jay takes on a tired old cabinet.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigating the growing crime of letter-bombing in the USA, and exploring the techniques forensic lab technicians use to trace the perpetrators.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of physical therapist Holly Cantrell, a mother-of-three who vanished in January 2017 in McAlester, Oklahoma. It transpired that Holly harboured a web of secrets that may have led to her disappearance.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Ali Lowitzer. In 2012, two years after the then 16-year-old vanished, Texas police received a tip that she may have been trafficked. The search turned into a rescue mission.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: With Alaska coming up short, Liz has flown 4,000 miles to find a dress, while Amanda has exhausted all options in Europe and has high hopes for the salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Erin wants a blue dress for her wedding, but must persuade her sceptical entourage, while Kate goes in search of a unique gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Petite bride Christine hopes to find a gown to match her 1920s-themed wedding, while Valentina returns for her fitting to add a personal touch to her dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dorothy's friend Danielle has a surprise in store, while consultant Katie is delighted to turn customer for the day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Samantha wants a dress that shows off her tattoo, but her mother is not impressed. Meanwhile, singer Vanessa needs a 1930s-style dress for her jazz-inspired wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Kristi is marrying a pro-baseball pitcher and needs a glamorous dress, while sports fan Jenna wants a gown that will impress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Patti Ann makes the trip all the way from Chicago to find the right dress for her Bahamas wedding, while Merav has budget issues when she starts looking for her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant girl Ashley wants a completely new look, although her family is not keen on the idea, while rodeo queen Becky wants to stand out.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to the Malvern Hills, where he unearths one of his most unusual finds. Plus, he visits a famed stone mason's in Liverpool to examine rare artisan carvings.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Upholsterer Ray Clarke tries to transform an unwanted pair of chairs, Josh and Oli have to show their mettle with some discarded brass and Jay takes on a tired old cabinet.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman who weighs 700 pounds is completely dependent on her husband and lives in constant fear that she will die, so tries to change her diet prior to gastric surgery.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: A local psychic claims to have had a vision of the fate of a nine-year-old boy abducted from a bus stop.
